types.name: DeleteImmediatelyManagerType
types.doc: Constructs a minimal ClassfileManager that immediately deletes class files when requested.

types.name: IncOptions
doc: Represents all configuration options for the incremental compiler itself and
not the underlying Java/Scala compiler.

fields.name: transitiveStep
fields.doc: After which step include whole transitive closure of invalidated source files.

fields.name: recompileAllFraction
doc: What's the fraction of invalidated source files when we switch to recompiling
all files and giving up incremental compilation altogether. That's useful in
cases when probability that we end up recompiling most of source files but
in multiple steps is high. Multi-step incremental recompilation is slower
than recompiling everything in one step.

fields.name: relationsDebug
fields.doc: Print very detailed information about relations, such as dependencies between source files.

fields.name: apiDebug
doc: Enable tools for debugging API changes.

fields.name: apiDiffContextSize
doc: Controls context size (in lines) displayed when diffs are produced for textual API
representation.
This option is used only when `apiDebug == true`.

fields.name: apiDumpDirectory
doc: The directory where we dump textual representation of APIs. This method might be called
only if apiDebug returns true. This is unused option at the moment as the needed functionality
is not implemented yet.

fields.name: classfileManagerType
fields.doc: ClassfileManager that will handle class file deletion and addition during a single incremental compilation run.

fields.name: recompileOnMacroDef
doc: Determines whether incremental compiler should recompile all dependencies of a file
that contains a macro definition.

fields.name: nameHashing
doc: Determines whether incremental compiler uses the new algorithm known as name hashing.

fields.name: antStyle
doc: THE `antStyle` OPTION IS UNSUPPORTED, MAY GO AWAY AT ANY POINT.
Enables "ant-style" mode of incremental compilation. This mode emulates what Ant's scalac command does.
The idea is to recompile just changed source files and not perform any invalidation of dependencies. This
is a very naive mode of incremental compilation that very often leads to broken binaries.
The Ant-style mode has been introduced because Scala team might need it for migration of Scala compiler to sbt.
It was added as a defensive measure so that the SBT build would be at least no worse than Ant wrt
recompilation. When working on changes that are pathological for the normal inc compiler mode, one
could switch in to this mode and use our old tricks of touching files we know need recompilation.
The name hashing algorithm doesn't work well with Scala compiler sources due to deep inheritance chains.
There's a plan to refactor compiler's code to use more composition instead of inheritance.
Once Scala compiler sources are refactored to work well with name hashing algorithm this option will be
deleted immediately.
See also https://github.com/sbt/incrementalcompiler/issues/22

types.name: CompileOptions
doc: Compilation options.

fields.name: classpath
doc: The classpath to use for compilation.
This will be modified according to the ClasspathOptions used to configure the ScalaCompiler.

fields.name: sources
doc: All sources that should be recompiled.
This should include Scala and Java sources, which are identified by their extension.

fields.name: scalacOptions
doc: The options to pass to the Scala compiler other than the sources and classpath to use.

fields.name: javacOptions
doc: The options to pass to the Java compiler other than the sources and classpath to use.

fields.name: order
doc: Controls the order in which Java and Scala sources are compiled.

types.name: MiniOptions
doc: Compilation options. This is used as part of CompileSetup.

fields.name: scalacOptions
doc: The options to pass to the Scala compiler other than the sources and classpath to use.

fields.name: javacOptions
doc: The options to pass to the Java compiler other than the sources and classpath to use.

types.name: MiniSetup
doc: This is used as part of CompileResult.

types.name: CompileAnalysis
doc: Represents the analysis of an incremental compilation.

types.name: CompileResult
doc: The result of running the incremental compilation.

types.name: PreviousResult
doc: The previous source dependency analysis result from compilation.

types.name: Setup
doc: Configures incremental recompilation.

fields.name: perClasspathEntryLookup
doc: Provides a lookup of data structures and operations associated with a single classpath entry.

fields.name: fileWatch
doc: Detects change in file system.

fields.name: skip
doc: If true, no sources are actually compiled and the Analysis from the previous compilation is returned.

fields.name: cacheFile
doc: The file used to cache information across compilations.
This file can be removed to force a full recompilation.
The file should be unique and not shared between compilations.

fields.name: reporter
doc: The reporter that should be used to report scala compilation to.

types.name: Inputs
doc: Configures a single compilation of a single set of sources.

fields.name: compilers
doc: The Scala and Java compilers to use for compilation.

fields.name: options
doc: Standard compilation options, such as the sources and classpath to use.

fields.name: setup
doc: Configures incremental compilation.

types.name: FileChanges
doc: Changes detected to the file system since a given time.

fields.name: beginTime
doc: The begin time for the range monitoring the change, given in millisecond.

fields.name: endTime
doc: The end time for the range monitoring the change, given in millisecond.

fields.name: added
doc: Added files.

fields.name: removed
doc: Removed files.

fields.name: changed
doc: Files that were modified.

types.name: Compilers
doc: The instances of Scalac/Javac used to compile the current project.

fields.name: scalac
doc: A `ScalaCompiler`.
It should be cached by the client if desired.

fields.name: javaTools
doc: Tool chain of Java.

types.name: ClasspathOptions
doc: Configures modifications to the classpath based on the Scala instance used for compilation.
This is typically used for the Scala compiler only and all values set to false for the Java compiler.

fields.name: bootLibrary
doc: If true, includes the Scala library on the boot classpath.
This should usually be true.

fields.name: compiler
doc: If true, includes the Scala compiler on the standard classpath.
This is typically false and is instead managed by the build tool or environment.

fields.name: extra
doc: If true, includes extra jars from the Scala instance on the standard classpath.
This is typically false and is instead managed by the build tool or environment.

fields.name: autoBoot
doc: If true, automatically configures the boot classpath.
This should usually be true.

fields.name: filterLibrary
doc: If true, the Scala library jar is filtered from the standard classpath.
This should usually be true because the library should be included on the boot classpath of the Scala compiler and not the standard classpath.
